results.title: The Cow who fell in the canal
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: Hendrika was a fine Dutch cow who was very unhappy on Mr. Hofstra’s farm. Then one day she fell into the canal and floated down to the city on a raft. Peter Spier’s delightfully zany illustrations are a perfect complement to this rib-tickling tale. Based on the book of the same title written by Phyllis Krasilovsky and illustrated by Peter Spier. Narrated by Owen Jordan.

results.title: The Cow tail switch: A folktale of Africa (K)
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Stephen Bosustow Productions and Steven Clark
results.brief_description: This animated folktale from the Liberian rain-forest recounts the death and return to life of the spirit to conquer death. Ogaloussa disappears and is forgotten by his family until a new son, Puli, in his first words asks for his father. A search yields Ogaloussa’s bones and his sons magically restore him to life. When Ogaloussa wants to give a beautiful cow tail switch to the son who did most to resuscitate him, he rewards Puli. For, the saying goes: “A man is not dead until he is forgotten”. The entire story is told by an African mother to her children. Adapted from the book “The Cow-Tail Switch” by Harold Courlander and George Herzog.

results.title: The Cow and it's relatives
results.brief_description: The domestic cow and bull, and a very young calf are shown in their usual farm surroundings. The Indian humped cow, the zebu and the Yak of Tibet (also domesticated animals) the American bison or buffalo are shown; and finally, African antelopes of various kinds - the kudo, the nyala, the giant eland, the roan antelopes and the addax antelopes are presented briefly. The antelope is, biologically speaking, a close relative to the cow.

results.title: The Cow
results.creator_credit: Dimension Films and Michael D. Murphy
results.brief_description: Explores the activities of cows on a peaceful day in the pasture, using natural sound and no narration. Highlights the colours and the shapes of bodies, the textures of noses and hides, the chewing of cuds. Music by Robert Emenegger.

results.title: The Cousins = Les Cousins
results.brief_description: Les Cousins is Chabrol’s second feature film which re-unites Jean-Claude Brialy and Gerard Blain, the two lead actors from his debut feature, “Le Beau Serge”. Paul (Brialy) is a hedonistic and confident Parisian student living in his uncle’s fashionable inner city flat. Paul spends his time drinking, carousing, and sleeping with a variety of female friends. Paul adopts the role of matchmaker for his friends, arranging trysts in an ongoing merry go round of bed partners. Paul is an emotionally remote and decadent man, adhering to a dubious moral code, who approaches his friends’ love lives with devilish detachment. Charles (Blain) is his naive country cousin, a dedicated student, who stays with Paul whilst studying for his law exams. When Charles is introduced to Paul’s swinging set, he instantaneously falls for Florence, a beautiful woman who is intrigued by Charles’ innocence. Paul is perturbed as he observes the attraction between the two and the respect that Charles displays for Florence. A clash is inevitable as the rivalry for Florence’s affection grows. The contrast between the two main characters’ morality is acute, especially in their attitudes toward women. “Les Cousins” depicts some very ethically dubious characters and is a dramatic study of class conflict and personal responsibility. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Court jester
results.creator_credit: Dena Enterprises, Norman Panama and Melvin Frank
results.brief_description: Danny Kaye is the quintessential singing, dancing, royal clown in this classic musical comedy set in 12th century England which parodies Robin Hood style swashbuckling adventure films. He plays a court jester who accidentally falls in with a band of outlaws who are plotting to kill the king. They try to use the unwitting fool to get close to the king, however they do not reckon on his ability as a jouster as well as a jester, which brings their plans undone in a hilarious manner. Cast also includes Basil Rathbone, Angela Lansbury, Glynis Johns and Cecil Parker.

results.title: The Court-martial of Billy Mitchell
results.creator_credit: Republic Pictures Corporation, Milton Sperling and Otto Preminger
results.brief_description: After World War One, Brigadier General Billy Mitchell, (Gary Cooper), forsees the deadly power and military importance of airplanes, previously used only by the US Army for reconnaissance. His superiors refuse to heed his advice, despite convincing evidence. When Mitchell persists in his campaign, he is called before a Court Martial and branded a traitor. Although General Duthrie, (Charles Bickford) attempts a cover-up at the trial, it becomes a media event, revealing how one man’s vision can shape history. This was the first screen appearance of Elizabeth Montgomery.

results.title: The County clerk
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information for Scottish Home Department and Campbell Harper
results.brief_description: The manifold duties of a Scottish County Clerk. As the administrative centre has to deal, directly or indirectly, with schools, health, housing, libraries and social services of every kind, and with the civil defence, fire services and police requirements of industry.

results.title: The Country mouse and the city mouse
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film based on Aesop’s fable about the a country mouse who visits his city cousin and discovers that despite the fun of the adventure, home is the best place.

results.title: The Country girl
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, William Perlberg and George Seaton
results.brief_description: Grace Kelly received an Oscar for her brilliant portrayal of the wife, and Bing Crosby gave one of the most outstanding performances of his career as an alcoholic, guilt-ridden has-been. When he is given an opportunity to star in a new musical show, his wife (Grace Kelly) and the show’s director (William Holden) attempt to bolster his ego and help him make a comeback. This superb drama, based on Clifford Odet’s play, was nominated for seven Academy Awards.
